captions.text: Hello, Nicholas.
Hello, Sergeant.
How's the hand?
Still a bit stiff.

lt can get awfully
hairy out there.

l'm surprised you weren't
snapped up sooner for
a nice desk job.
That's what l did.

l prefer to think
my office is out
on the street.
lndeed, you do.

Your arrest record
is 400O_ higher than
any other officer.

Which is why it's high time
that such skills were
put to better use.
We're making you Sergeant.
l see.

(MURMURS) In Sandford,
Gloucestershire.
ln where, sorry?

ln Sandford,
Gloucestershire.
That's in the country.
Yes, lovely.

lsn't there a Sergeant's
position here in London?
No.
Can l remain here as a PC?
No.

Do l have any choice
in this?
No.

Sergeant,
l kind of like it here.

Well, you've always wanted
to transfer to the country.
ln 20 years or so, yes.
Well done, you.

Hang on,
l don't remember
telling you that.
Yes, you did. You said,

l'd like to talk
to the Inspector.

You can speak
to the Inspector,
but l can promise you

he will tell you
exactly the same
thing as l have.

Hello, Nicholas.
How's the hand?
lt's still a bit stiff.

And how are things
at home?
l'm sorry, sir?
How's Janine?

We're no longer
together, sir.

Right. Then where
are you living?

He's staying at the
Section House, sir.
lNSPECTOR: With the recruits?

Yes, he's living out
of cardboard boxes.

Well, then,
you're packed already.

Nicholas,
we're offering you
a smashing position
with a delightful cottage,

in a lovely little place
that l think has won
Village of the Year

l don't know
how many times.
lt'll be good for you.

l don't really know
what to say.
Yes?
Yes, thank you.

No, l'm sorry.
l'm gonna have to...
You want to take this higher?
Yes, yes, l do.

You want me to bother
the Chief Inspector
with this?
Yes.

You want me to get
the Chief Inspector

to come all the way
down here?
Yes, l do.
Okay.
Kenneth!

Hello, Nicholas.
How's the hand?
Still a bit stiff.

Chief Inspector...
Keep your seat.

Now, l know what
you're going to say,

but the fact is,
you've been making
us all look bad.
l'm sorry, sir?

Of course we
all appreciate
your efforts,

but you've been rather
Ietting the side down.

lt's all about being
a team player, Nicholas.

You can't be the
Sheriff of London.

lf we let you carry on
running round town,

you'll continue
to be exceptional
and we can't have that.

You'll put us all
out of a job.
With respect, sir.

You can't iust make
people disappear.

Yes, l can.
l'm the Chief Inspector.

Well, however you spin this,
there's one thing you haven't
taken into account.

And that's what the ''team''
is gonna make of this.
